name: Hand Gesture Recognition
tagline: Implementation of the American Sign Language by detecting Hand Gestures using Kinect
body:
### Abstract
RGB-D cameras and depth sensors have made pos- sible the development of an uncountable number of applications in the field of human-computer interactions. Such applications, varying from gaming to medical, have made possible because of the capability of such sensors of elaborating depth maps of the placed ambient. In this context, aiming to realize a sound basis for future applications relevant to the movement and to the pose of hands, we propose a new approach to recognize fingertips and to identify their position by means of the Microsoft Kinect technology. The experimental results exhibit a really good identi- fication rate, an execution speed faster than the frame rate with no meaningful latencies, thus allowing the use of the proposed system in real time applications. Furthermore, the scored iden- tification accuracy confirms the excellent capability of following also little movements of the hand and it encourages the real pos- sibility of successive implementations in more complex gesture recognition systems.
